text.data-name: How well does the model perform?
text.tspan: How well does the model perform?

text.data-name: How often did we wrongly classify something as not true (= false?)
text.tspan: How often did we wrongly classify something as not true (= false?)

text.data-name: How often are we correct in our positive prediction? (or how much are we being wrong?)
text.tspan: How often are we correct in our positive prediction? (or how much are we

text.data-name: Utilize the precision and recall to create a test's accuracy through the "harmonic mean". Also known as the Sørensen–Dice Coefficient
text.tspan: Utilize the precision and recall to create a test's accuracy through the
"harmonic mean". Also known as the Sørensen–Dice Coefficient

text.data-name: The ROC curve allows us to select the optimal model and discard suboptimal ones.
text.tspan: The ROC curve allows us to select the optimal model and discard suboptimal ones.

text.data-name: False Positive Rate (FPR) = X-Axis True Positive Rate (TPR) = Y-Axis

1. Discretize the threshold for the confidence score (e.g. confidence score of [0, 1] becomes [0.0, ..., 0.9, 1.0] 2. Calculate the confusion matrix for the given threshold 3. Determine the TPR and FPR and plot them
text.tspan: 1. Discretize the threshold for the confidence score (e.g. confidence score of [0, 1] becomes [0.0, ..., 0.9, 1.0]
2. Calculate the confusion matrix for the given threshold
3. Determine the TPR and FPR and plot them

text.data-name:
TP (True Positive) & TN (True Negative): The prediction matches the Truth correctly E.g. we correctly predicted an object as a car
FP (False Positive) & FN (False Negative): The prediction does not match the Truth E.g. we incorrectly predicted an object

tspan.tspan: The prediction matches the Truth correctly
E.g. we correctly predicted an object as a car
E.g. we incorrectly predicted an object as a car, while it was

text.data-name: 5% of the time we said it was not a car, while it was a car (we could've hit it)
text.tspan: 5% of the time we said it was not a car, while it was a car (we could've hit it)

text.data-name: 5% of the time we said an object was a car, while it actually was not. (wrong action will be taken - e.g. increasing speed)
text.tspan: 5% of the time we said an object was a car, while it actually was not. (wrong
action will be taken - e.g. increasing speed)

text.data-name: Our model is 88% accurate based on high-business impact markers (#wrong detections and #false positives)
text.tspan: Our model is 88% accurate based on high-business impact markers (#wrong
